P.FONT: Paul: Morning, hi, sorry, so sorry I’m late …
Paul: … Oh and I was late at the airport as well, wasn’t I? You must think I’m absolutely hopeless … I do apologise.
Renata: Not to worry, let’s get going, shall we?
Renata: Yes, I had breakfast earlier.

Paul: ’cos I didn’t really have time, I left the house really early … and the traffic was … unbelievable, I forgot it was rush hour, and I was just stuck in this traffic jam thinking ‘Oh no! I’m going to be late’ … and suddenly I remembered this short cut, just to the left of the cinema, you know there’s a little side road on the left …
Renata: No, I really don’t know the city at all. Shall
Paul: Oh, of course not, silly me … well, anyway, I remembered a short cut, you just take this little side road to the left of the Odeon Cinema …
Renata: … and you took that, good … well …
Paul: … but unfortunately the short cut wasn’t exactly as I remembered. And I got a bit lost … and well eventually, I ended up going back by the original route …
Renata: Well, never mind, you’re here now. We’d better get started. I have a meeting at …

Paul: Excuse me, I’d better take this. Hello, yeah? … Hi … No … Yeah … why? … did she? … gosh … No … Oh well, don’t worry … What? … Yeah, will do … all right then. Okay, bye … bye mum. Sorry about that. Right are we ready?
Paul: Okay, let’s go … Oh, yes. Sorry. Let me take your bag.
